text: impiously positioned himself as the
voice of hardline unionism for decades
his critics called him dr. no but his
legacy was changed forever when he said
yes to power sharing an entered
government with Irish Republicans his
sworn enemies for so many years Ian
Richard Kyle Paisley was the son of a
Baptist minister and he was preaching
himself by the time he was a teenager
it's passion obvious in brutha pulpit
and in politics he was a man always sure
in his own beliefs creating the free
presbyterian church and his own
political party the Democratic Unionist
opposed attempts at power sharing in
Northern Ireland in the 1970s make over
America pal in the wake of its failure
Ian Paisley was to have success at the
ballot box opponents or was a bigot and
a troublemaker
they said he flirted with the extremes
of loyalism and he lent a support to the
shadowy grip Ulster resistance Paisley
became a brand name for a fight against
Irish republicanism he refused to
negotiate with shin fin and campaigned
against the Good Friday Agreement yes 71
point 1 2 percent the public may have
said yes but for almost a decade
Ian Paisley believed he continued to say
no eventually that changed and what once
seemed like the unthinkable came true he
entered government with shin fear by
that stage the DUP was the biggest party
making Ian Paisley Northern Ireland's
First Minister his deputy was Martin
McGuinness a former IRA leader and a man
he had long refused to talk to if they
built such a strong working relationship
that they became known as the Chuckle
brothers no no change if he had told me
40 years ago I would have attender where
I didn't see him I woulda laughed at you
and
certainly I'm havin a good innings I
made good friends and I've reconciled a
lotta enemies in death as in life
Ian Paisley will divide opinion but he
was in his own unique style a preacher a
protester and a peacemaker
